demo/graph/index.html.title: My Graph
demo/graph/index.html.content: Node 1.1 Composite Node 1 Node 2.1 Composite Node 2 Connection A Sub-Node 1.1.2 My Graph Node 1.1 Composite Node 1 Node 2.1 Composite Node 2 Connection A Sub-Node 1.1.2 My Graph

references/eClassifiers/ConnectionSource.title: Connection Source
references/eClassifiers/ConnectionSource.content: Source of connections uniquely identified by string ids. It provides support for graph inheritance - replacing (overriding), adding, or removing connections.

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.title: Documented Named Connection Source
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.content: Connection source with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.title: Documented Named Composite Connection Target
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.content: Composite connection target with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.title: Documented Named Connection
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.content: Connection with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/Tunnel/reference.title: connections
references/eClassifiers/Tunnel/reference.content: Type C Multiplicity 0..* Connections in this tunnel

references/eClassifiers/CompositeNode/in.title: Composite Node
references/eClassifiers/CompositeNode/in.content: Node which is also a sub-graph. I.e. it may contain other graph elements.

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedS.title: Documented Named Sub-Graph
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedS.content: Sub-graph with a name and documentation

index.html.title: Graph Model

references/eClassifiers/Graph/references.title: elements
references/eClassifiers/Graph/references.content: Type E Multiplicity 0..* Graph elements uniquely identified by a string. This allows to implement graph inheritance - deriving a graph from another graph by removing, adding and replacing graph elements similar to how inheritance works in object-oriented languages.

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedG.title: Documented Named Graph Element
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedG.content: Gaph element with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/CompositeConnect.title: Composite Connection Target
references/eClassifiers/CompositeConnect.content: Connection target which is also as sub-graph, i.e. it may contain other graph elements

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.title: Documented Named Composite Connection Source
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.content: Composite connection source with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/Node/index.html.title: Node
references/eClassifiers/Node/index.html.content: Node is both connection source and target. I.e. it may have both incoming and outgoing connections.

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedG.title: Documented Named Graph
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedG.content: Graph with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/Tunnel/index.htm.title: Tunnel
references/eClassifiers/Tunnel/index.htm.content: Tunnel is a connection which logically groups (aggregates) other connections. For example, two composite nodes may have a tunnel connection which groups connections between their child elements. A real life example is a VPN tunnel between two networks.

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.title: Documented Named Connection Target
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.content: Connection target with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/ConnectionTarget.title: Connection Target
references/eClassifiers/ConnectionTarget.content: A graph element which can have incoming connections

references/eClassifiers/Connection/refer.title: bidirectional
references/eClassifiers/Connection/refer.content: Type EBoolean Multiplicity 0..1 Indicates that the connection is bidirectional

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.title: Documented Named Composite Node
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedC.content: Composite node with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedN.title: Documented Named Node
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedN.content: Node with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/SubGraph/index.h.title: Sub-graph
references/eClassifiers/SubGraph/index.h.content: A graph element which is also a graph, i.e. it may contain other graph elements.

references/eClassifiers/GraphElement/ind.title: Graph Element
references/eClassifiers/GraphElement/ind.content: Graph element uniquely identified in the containing graph by a string identifier (key). This allows to implement graph inheritance - deriving a graph from another graph by removing, adding and replacing graph elements similar to how inheritance works in object-oriented languages.

references/eClassifiers/Graph/index.html.title: Graph
references/eClassifiers/Graph/index.html.content: Graph is a container of graph elements uniquely identified by a string. This allows to implement graph inheritance - deriving a graph from another graph by removing, adding and replacing graph elements similar to how inheritance works in object-oriented languages.

references/eClassifiers/CompositeConnect.title: Composite Connection Source
references/eClassifiers/CompositeConnect.content: Connection source which is also a sub-graph. I.e. it may contain other graph elements.

references/eClassifiers/ConnectionSource.title: outgoingConnections
references/eClassifiers/ConnectionSource.content: Type C Multiplicity 0..* Outgoing connections uniquely identified by a string to support graph inheritance

references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedT.title: Documented Named Tunnel
references/eClassifiers/DocumentedNamedT.content: Tunnel with a name and documentation

references/eClassifiers/Connection/index.title: Connection
references/eClassifiers/Connection/index.content: Connections are contained by their source and uniquiely identified in the source by a string id. This allows to implement connection inheritance behaviors such as overriding (replacing), adding, or removing.
